monsters.name: Acid Burrower
monsters.description: A horse-sized insect with digging claws and acidic blood.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Burrow, drag away, feed, reposition

feats.name: Relentless (3) - Passive
feats.text: The Burrower can be spotlighted up to three times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

feats.name: Earth Eruption - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to have the Burrower burst out of the ground. All creatures within Very Close range must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or be knocked over, making them Vulnerable until they next act.

feats.name: Spit Acid - Action
feats.text: Make an attack against all targets in front of the Burrower within Close range. Targets the Burrower succeeds against take 2d6 physical damage and must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can’t mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP and you gain a Fear.

feats.name: Acid Bath - Reaction
feats.text: When the Burrower takes Severe damage, all creatures within Close range are bathed in their acidic blood, taking 1d10 physical damage. This splash covers the ground within Very Close range with blood, and all creatures other than the Burrower who move through it take 1d6 physical damage.

monsters.name: Bear
monsters.description: A large bear with thick fur and powerful claws.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Climb, defend territory, pummel, track

feats.name: Overwhelming Force - Passive
feats.text: Targets who mark HP from the Bear’s standard attack are knocked back to Very Close range.

feats.name: Bite - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, deal 3d4+10 physical damage and the target is Restrained until they break free with a successful Strength Roll.

feats.name: Momentum - Reaction
feats.text: When the Bear makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

monsters.name: Cave Ogre
monsters.description: A massive humanoid who sees all sapient life as food.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Bite off heads, feast, rip limbs, stomp, throw enemies

feats.name: Ramp Up - Passive
feats.text: You must spend a Fear to spotlight the Ogre. While spotlighted, they can make their standard attack against all targets within range.

feats.name: Bone Breaker - Passive
feats.text: The Ogre’s attacks deal direct damage.

feats.name: Hail of Boulders - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to pick up heavy objects and throw them at all targets in front of the Ogre within Far range. Make an attack against these targets. Targets the Ogre succeeds against take 1d10+2 physical damage. If they succeed against more than one target, you gain a Fear.

feats.name: Rampaging Fury - Reaction
feats.text: When the Ogre marks 2 or more HP, they can rampage. Move the Ogre to a point within Close range and deal 2d6+3 direct physical damage to all targets in their path.

monsters.name: Construct
monsters.description: A roughly humanoid being of stone and steel, assembled and animated by magic.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Destroy environment, serve creator, smash target, trample groups

feats.name: Relentless (2) - Passive
feats.text: The Construct can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

feats.name: Weak Structure - Passive
feats.text: When the Construct marks HP from physical damage, they must mark an additional HP.

feats.name: Trample - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to make an attack against all targets in the Construct’s path when they move. Targets the Construct succeeds against take 1d8 physical damage.

feats.name: Overload - Reaction
feats.text: Before rolling damage for the Construct’s attack, you can mark a Stress to gain a +10 bonus to the damage roll. The Construct can then take the spotlight again.

feats.name: Death Quake - Reaction
feats.text: When the Construct marks their last HP, the magic powering them ruptures in an explosion of force. Make an attack with advantage against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Construct succeeds against take 1d12+2 magic damage.

monsters.name: Courtier
monsters.description: An ambitious and ostentatiously dressed socialite.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Discreet, gain favor, maneuver, scheme

feats.name: Mockery - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to say something mocking and force a target within Close range to make a Presence Reaction Roll (14) to see if they can save face. On a failure, the target must mark 2 Stress and is Vulnerable until the scene ends.

feats.name: Scapegoat - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear and target a PC. The Courtier convinces a crowd or prominent individual that the target is the cause of their current conflict or misfortune.

monsters.name: Deeproot Defender
monsters.description: A burly vegetable-person with grasping vines.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Ambush, grab, protect, pummel

feats.name: Ground Slam - Action
feats.text: Slam the ground, knocking all targets within Very Close range back to Far range. Each target knocked back by this must mark a Stress.

feats.name: Grab and Drag - Action
feats.text: Make an attack against a target within Close range. On a success, spend a Fear to pull them into Melee range, deal 1d6+2 physical damage, and Restrain them until the Defender takes Severe damage.

monsters.name: Dire Wolf
monsters.description: A large wolf with menacing teeth, seldom encountered alone.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Defend territory, harry, protect pack, surround, trail

feats.name: Pack Tactics - Passive
feats.text: If the Wolf makes a successful standard attack and another Dire Wolf is within Melee range of the target, deal 1d6+5 physical damage instead of their standard damage and you gain a Fear.

feats.name: Hobbling Strike - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, deal 3d4+10 direct physical damage and make them Vulnerable until they clear at least 1 HP.

monsters.name: Giant Mosquitoes
monsters.description: Dozens of fist-sized mosquitoes, flying together for protection.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Fly away, harass, steal blood

feats.name: Horde (1d4+1) - Passive
feats.text: When the Mosquitoes have marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 1d4+1 physical damage instead.

feats.name: Flying - Passive
feats.text: While flying, the Mosquitoes have a +2 bonus to their Difficulty.

feats.name: Bloodseeker - Reaction
feats.text: When the Mosquitoes’ attack causes a target to mark HP, you can mark a Stress to force the target to mark an additional HP.

monsters.name: Giant Rat
monsters.description: A cat-sized rodent skilled at scavenging and survival.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Burrow, hunger, scavenge, wear down

feats.name: Minion (3) - Passive
feats.text: The Rat is defeated when they take any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to the Rat, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

feats.name: Group Attack - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Giant Rats within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 1 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

monsters.name: Giant Scorpion
monsters.description: A human-sized insect with tearing claws and a stinging tail.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Ambush, feed, grapple, poison

feats.name: Double Strike - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against two targets within Melee range.

feats.name: Venomous Stinger - Action
feats.text: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, spend a Fear to deal 1d4+4 physical damage and Poison them until their next rest or they succeed on a Knowledge Roll (16). While Poisoned, the target must roll a d6 before they make an action roll. On a result of 4 or lower, they must mark a Stress.

feats.name: Momentum - Reaction
feats.text: When the Scorpion makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

monsters.name: Glass Snake
monsters.description: A clear serpent with a massive head that leaves behind a glass shard trail wherever they go.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Climb, feed, keep distance, scare

feats.name: Armor-Shredding Shards - Passive
feats.text: On a successful attack within Melee range against the Snake, the attacker must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can’t mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

feats.name: Spinning Serpent - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to make an attack against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Snake succeeds against take 1d6+1 physical damage.

feats.name: Spitter - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to introduce a 6 Spitter Die. When the Snake is in the spotlight, roll this die. On a result of 5 or higher, all targets in front of the Snake within Far range must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or take 1d4 physical damage. The Snake can take the spotlight a second time this GM turn.

monsters.name: Harrier
monsters.description: A nimble fighter armed with javelins.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Flank, harry, kite, profit

feats.name: Maintain Distance - Passive
feats.text: After making a standard attack, the Harrier can move anywhere within Far range.

feats.name: Fall Back - Reaction
feats.text: When a creature moves into Melee range to make an attack, you can mark a Stress before the attack roll to move anywhere within Close range and make an attack against that creature. On a success, deal 1d10+2 physical damage.

monsters.name: Archer Guard
monsters.description: A tall guard bearing a longbow and quiver with arrows fletched in the settlement’s colors.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Arrest, close gates, make it through the day, pin down

feats.name: Hobbling Shot - Action
feats.text: Make an attack against a target within Far range. On a success, mark a Stress to deal 1d12+3 physical damage. If the target marks HP from this attack, they have disadvantage on Agility Rolls until they clear at least 1 HP.

monsters.name: Bladed Guard
monsters.description: An armored guard bearing a sword and shield painted in the settlement’s colors.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Arrest, close gates, make it through the day, pin down

feats.name: Shield Wall - Passive
feats.text: A creature who tries to move within Very Close range of the Guard must succeed on an Agility Roll. If additional Bladed Guards are standing in a line alongside the first, and each is within Melee range of another guard in the line, the Difficulty increases by the total number of guards in the line.

feats.name: Detain - Action
feats.text: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, mark a Stress to Restrain the target until they break free with a successful attack, Finesse Roll, or Strength Roll.

monsters.name: Head Guard
monsters.description: A seasoned guard with a mace, a whistle, and a bellowing voice.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Arrest, close gates, pin down, seek glory

feats.name: Rally Guards - Action
feats.text: Spend 2 Fear to spotlight the Head Guard and up to 2d4 allies within Far range.

feats.name: On My Signal - Reaction
feats.text: Countdown (5). When the Head Guard is in the spotlight for the first time, activate the countdown. It ticks down when a PC makes an attack roll. When it triggers, all Archer Guards within Far range make a standard attack with advantage against the nearest target within their range. If any attacks succeed on the same target, combine their damage.

feats.name: Momentum - Reaction
feats.text: When the Head Guard makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

monsters.name: Jagged Knife Bandit
monsters.description: A cunning criminal in a cloak bearing one of the gang’s iconic knives.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Escape, profit, steal, throw smoke

feats.name: Climber - Passive
feats.text: The Bandit climbs just as easily as they run.

feats.name: From Above - Passive
feats.text: When the Bandit succeeds on a standard attack from above a target, they deal 1d10+1 physical damage instead of their standard damage.

monsters.name: Jagged Knife Hexer
monsters.description: A staff-wielding bandit in a cloak adorned with magical paraphernalia, using curses to vex their foes.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Command, hex, profit

feats.name: Curse - Action
feats.text: Choose a target within Far range and temporarily Curse them. While the target is Cursed, you can mark a Stress so that target rolls with Hope to make the roll be with Fear instead.

feats.name: Chaotic Flux - Action
feats.text: Make an attack against up to three targets within Very Close range. Mark a Stress to deal 2d6+3 magic damage to targets the Hexer succeeded against.

monsters.name: Jagged Knife Kneebreaker
monsters.description: An imposing brawler carrying a large club.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Grapple, intimidate, profit, steal

feats.name: I’ve Got ‘Em - Passive
feats.text: Creatures Restrained by the Kneebreaker take double damage from attacks by other adversaries.

feats.name: Hold Them Down - Action
feats.text: Make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, the target takes no damage but is Restrained and Vulnerable. The target can break free, clearing both conditions, with a successful Strength Roll or is freed automatically if the Kneebreaker takes Major or greater damage.

monsters.name: Jagged Knife Lackey
monsters.description: A thief with simple clothes and small daggers, eager to prove themselves.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Escape, profit, throw smoke

feats.name: Minion (3) - Passive
feats.text: The Lackey is defeated when they take any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to the Lackey, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

feats.name: Group Attack - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Jagged Knife Lackeys within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 2 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

monsters.name: Jagged Knife Lieutenant
monsters.description: A seasoned bandit in quality leathers with a strong voice and cunning eyes.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Bully, command, profit, reinforce

feats.name: Tactician - Action
feats.text: When you spotlight the Lieutenant, mark a Stress to also spotlight two allies within Close range.

feats.name: More Where That Came From - Action
feats.text: Summon three Jagged Knife Lackeys, who appear at Far range.

feats.name: Coup de Grace - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to make an attack against a Vulnerable target within Close range. On a success, deal 2d6+12 physical damage and the target must mark a Stress.

feats.name: Momentum - Reaction
feats.text: When the Lieutenant makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

monsters.name: Jagged Knife Shadow
monsters.description: A nimble scoundrel bearing a wicked knife and utilizing shadow magic to isolate targets.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Ambush, conceal, divide, profit

feats.name: Backstab - Passive
feats.text: When the Shadow succeeds on a standard attack that has advantage, they deal 1d6+6 physical damage instead of their standard damage.

feats.name: Cloaked - Action
feats.text: Become Hidden until after the Shadow’s next attack. Attacks made while Hidden from this feature have advantage.

monsters.name: Jagged Knife Sniper
monsters.description: A lanky bandit striking from cover with a shortbow.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Ambush, hide, profit, reposition

feats.name: Unseen Strike - Passive
feats.text: If the Sniper is Hidden when they make a successful standard attack against a target, they deal 1d10+4 physical damage instead of their standard damage.

monsters.name: Merchant
monsters.description: A finely dressed trader with a keen eye for financial gain.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Buy low and sell high, create demand, inflate prices, seek profit

feats.name: Preferential Treatment - Passive
feats.text: A PC who succeeds on a Presence Roll against the Merchant gains a discount on purchases. A PC who fails on a Presence Roll against the Merchant must pay more and has disadvantage on future Presence Rolls against the Merchant.

feats.name: The Runaround - Passive
feats.text: When a PC rolls a 14 or lower on a Presence Roll made against the Merchant, they must mark a Stress.

monsters.name: Minor Chaos Elemental
monsters.description: A coruscating mass of uncontrollable magic.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Confound, destabilize, transmogrify

feats.name: Arcane Master - Passive
feats.text: The Elemental is resistant to magic damage.

feats.name: Sickening Flux - Action
feats.text: Mark a HP to force all targets within Close range to mark a Stress and become Vulnerable until their next rest or they clear a HP.

feats.name: Remake Reality - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to transform the area within Very Close range into a different biome. All targets within this area take 2d6+3 direct magic damage.

feats.name: Magical Reflection - Reaction
feats.text: When the Elemental takes damage from an attack within Close range, deal an amount of damage to the attacker equal to half of the damage they dealt.

feats.name: Momentum - Reaction
feats.text: When the Elemental makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

monsters.name: Minor Fire Elemental
monsters.description: A living flame the size of a large bonfire.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Encircle enemies, grow in size, intimidate, start fires

feats.name: Relentless (2) - Passive
feats.text: The Elemental can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

feats.name: Scorched Earth - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to choose a point within Far range. The ground within Very Close range of that point immediately bursts into flames. All creatures within this area must make an Agility Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take 2d8 magic damage from the flames. Targets who succeed take half damage.

feats.name: Explosion - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to erupt in a fiery explosion. Make an attack against all targets within Close range. Targets the Elemental succeeds against take 1d8 magic damage and are knocked back to Far range.

feats.name: Consume Kindling - Reaction
feats.text: Three times per scene, when the Elemental moves on objects that are highly flammable, consume them to clear a HP or a Stress.

feats.name: Momentum - Reaction
feats.text: When the Elemental makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

monsters.name: Minor Demon
monsters.description: A crimson-hued creature from the Circles Below, consumed by rage against all mortals.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Act erratically, corral targets, relish pain, torment

feats.name: Relentless (2) - Passive
feats.text: The Demon can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

feats.name: All Must Fall - Passive
feats.text: When a PC rolls a failure with Fear while within Close range of the Demon, they lose a Hope.

feats.name: Hellfire - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to rain down hellfire within Far range. All targets within the area must make an Agility Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take 1d20+3 magic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

feats.name: Reaper - Reaction
feats.text: Before rolling damage for the Demon’s attack, you can mark a Stress to gain a bonus to the damage roll equal to the Demon’s current number of marked HP.

feats.name: Momentum - Reaction
feats.text: When the Demon makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

monsters.name: Minor Treant
monsters.description: An ambulatory sapling rising up to defend their forest.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Crush, overwhelm, protect

feats.name: Minion (5) - Passive
feats.text: The Treant is defeated when they take any damage. For every 5 damage a PC deals to the Treant, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

feats.name: Group Attack - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Minor Treants within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 4 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

monsters.name: Green Ooze
monsters.description: A moving mound of translucent green slime.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Camouflage, consume and multiply, creep up, envelop

feats.name: Slow - Passive
feats.text: When you spotlight the Ooze and they don’t have a token on their stat block, they can’t act. Place a token on their stat block and describe what they’re preparing to do. When you spotlight the Ooze and they have a token on their stat block, clear the token and they can act.

feats.name: Acidic Form - Passive
feats.text: When the Ooze makes a successful attack, the target must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can’t mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

feats.name: Envelope - Action
feats.text: Make a standard attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, the Ooze envelops them and the target must mark 2 Stress. The target must mark an additional Stress when they make an action roll. If the Ooze takes Severe damage, the target is freed.

feats.name: Split - Reaction
feats.text: When the Ooze has 3 or more HP marked, you can spend a Fear to split them into two Tiny Green Oozes (with no marked HP or Stress). Immediately spotlight both of them.

monsters.name: Tiny Green Ooze
monsters.description: A small moving mound of translucent green slime.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Camouflage, creep up

feats.name: Acidic Form - Passive
feats.text: When the Ooze makes a successful attack, the target must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can’t mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

monsters.name: Red Ooze
monsters.description: A moving mound of translucent flaming red slime.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Camouflage, consume and multiply, ignite, start fires

feats.name: Creeping Fire - Passive
feats.text: The Ooze can only move within Very Close range as their normal movement. They light any flammable object they touch on fire.

feats.name: Ignite - Action
feats.text: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, the target takes 1d8 magic damage and is ignited until they’re extinguished with a successful Finesse Roll (14). While ignited, the target takes 1d4 magic damage when they make an action roll.

feats.name: Split - Reaction
feats.text: When the Ooze has 3 or more HP marked, you can spend a Fear to split them into two Tiny Red Oozes (with no marked HP or Stress). Immediately spotlight both of them.

monsters.name: Tiny Red Ooze
monsters.description: A small moving mound of translucent flaming red slime.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Blaze, camouflage

feats.name: Burning - Reaction
feats.text: When a creature within Melee range deals damage to the Ooze, they take 1d6 direct magic damage.

monsters.name: Petty Noble
monsters.description: A richly dressed and adorned aristocrat brimming with hubris.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Abuse power, gather resources, mobilize minions

feats.name: My Land, My Rules - Passive
feats.text: All social actions made against the Noble on their land have disadvantage.

feats.name: Guards, Seize Them! - Action
feats.text: Once per scene, mark a Stress to summon 1d4 Bladed Guards, who appear at Far range to enforce the Noble’s will.

feats.name: Exile - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear and target a PC. The Noble proclaims that the target and their allies are exiled from the noble’s territory. While exiled, the target and their allies have disadvantage during social situations within the Noble’s domain.

monsters.name: Pirate Captain
monsters.description: A charismatic sea dog with an impressive hat, eager to raid and plunder.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Command, make 'em walk the plank, plunder, raid

feats.name: Swashbuckler - Passive
feats.text: When the Captain marks 2 or fewer HP from an attack within Melee range, the attacker must mark a Stress.

feats.name: Reinforcements - Action
feats.text: Once per scene, mark a Stress to summon a Pirate Raiders Horde, which appears at Far range.

feats.name: No Quarter - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to choose a target who has three or more Pirates within Melee range of them. The Captain leads the Pirates in hurling threats and promises of a watery grave. The target must make a Presence Reaction Roll. On a failure, the target marks 1d4+1 Stress. On a success, they must mark a Stress.

feats.name: Momentum - Reaction
feats.text: When the Captain makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

monsters.name: Pirate Raiders
monsters.description: Seafaring scoundrels moving in a ravaging pack.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Gang up, plunder, overwhelm

feats.name: Horde (1d4+1) - Passive
feats.text: When the Raiders have marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 1d4+1 physical damage instead.

feats.name: Swashbuckler - Passive
feats.text: When the Raiders mark 2 or fewer HP from an attack within Melee range, the attacker must mark a Stress.

monsters.name: Pirate Tough
monsters.description: A thickly muscled and tattooed pirate with melon-sized fists.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Plunder, raid, smash, terrorize

feats.name: Swashbuckler - Passive
feats.text: When the Tough marks 2 or fewer HP from an attack within Melee range, the attacker must mark a Stress.

feats.name: Clear the Decks - Action
feats.text: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, mark a Stress to move into Melee range of the target, dealing 3d4 physical damage and knocking the target back to Close range.

monsters.name: Sellsword
monsters.description: An armed mercenary testing their luck.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Charge, lacerate, overwhelm, profit

feats.name: Minion (4) - Passive
feats.text: The Sellsword is defeated when they take any damage. For every 4 damage a PC deals to the Sellsword, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

feats.name: Group Attack - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Sellswords within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 3 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

monsters.name: Skeleton Archer
monsters.description: A fragile skeleton with a shortbow and arrows.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Perforate distracted targets, play dead, steal skin

feats.name: Opportunist - Passive
feats.text: When two or more adversaries are within Very Close range of a creature, all damage they each deal to that creature is doubled.

feats.name: Deadly Shot - Action
feats.text: Make an attack against a Vulnerable target within Far range. On a success, mark a Stress to deal 3d4+8 physical damage.

monsters.name: Skeleton Dredge
monsters.description: A clattering pile of bones.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Fall apart, overwhelm, play dead, steal skin

feats.name: Minion (4) - Passive
feats.text: The Dredge is defeated when they take any damage. For every 4 damage a PC deals to the Dredge, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

feats.name: Group Attack - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Dredges within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 1 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

monsters.name: Skeleton Knight
monsters.description: A large armored skeleton with a huge blade.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Cut down the living, steal skin, wreak havoc

feats.name: Terrifying - Passive
feats.text: When the Knight makes a successful attack, all PCs within Close range lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.

feats.name: Cut to the Bone - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to make an attack against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Knight succeeds against take 1d8+2 physical damage and must mark a Stress.

feats.name: Dig Two Graves - Reaction
feats.text: When the Knight is defeated, they make an attack against a target within Very Close range (prioritizing the creature who killed them). On a success, the target takes 1d8+4 physical damage and loses 1d4 Hope.

monsters.name: Skeleton Warrior
monsters.description: A dirt-covered skeleton armed with a rusted blade.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Feign death, gang up, steal skin

feats.name: Only Bones - Passive
feats.text: The Warrior is resistant to physical damage.

feats.name: Reform - Reaction
feats.text: When the Warrior is defeated, roll a d6. On a result of 6, if there are other adversaries on the battlefield, the Warrior re-forms with no marked HP.

monsters.name: Spellblade
monsters.description: A mercenary combining swordplay and magic to deadly effect.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Blast, command, endure

feats.name: Arcane Steel - Passive
feats.text: Damage dealt by the Spellblade’s standard attack is considered both physical and magic.

feats.name: Suppressing Blast - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress and target a group within Far range. All targets must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or take 1d8+2 magic damage. You gain a Fear for each target who marked HP from this attack.

feats.name: Move as Unit - Action
feats.text: Spend 2 Fear to spotlight up to five allies within Far range.

feats.name: Momentum - Reaction
feats.text: When the Spellblade makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

monsters.name: Swarm of Rats
monsters.description: A skittering mass of ordinary rodents moving as one like a ravenous wave.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Consume, obscure, swarm

feats.name: Horde (1d4+1) - Passive
feats.text: When the Swarm has marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 1d4+1 physical damage instead.

feats.name: In Your Face - Passive
feats.text: All targets within Melee range have disadvantage on attacks against targets other than the Swarm.

monsters.name: Sylvan Soldier
monsters.description: A faerie warrior adorned in armor made of leaves and bark.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Ambush, hide, overwhelm, protect, trail

feats.name: Pack Tactics - Passive
feats.text: If the Soldier makes a standard attack and another Sylvan Soldier is within Melee range of the target, deal 1d8+5 physical damage instead of their standard damage.

feats.name: Forest Control - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to pull down a tree within Close range. A creature hit by the tree must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll (15) or take 1d10 physical damage.

feats.name: Blend In - Reaction
feats.text: When the Soldier makes a successful attack, you can mark a Stress to become Hidden until the Soldier’s next attack or a PC succeeds on an Instinct Roll (14) to find them.

monsters.name: Tangle Bramble Swarm
monsters.description: A cluster of animated, blood-drinking tumbleweeds, each the size of a large gourd.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Digest, entangle, immobilize

feats.name: Horde (1d4+2) - Passive
feats.text: When the Swarm has marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 1d4+2 physical damage instead.

feats.name: Crush - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to deal 2d6+8 direct physical damage to a target with 3 or more bramble tokens.

feats.name: Encumber - Reaction
feats.text: When the Swarm succeeds on an attack, give the target a bramble token. If a target has any bramble tokens, they are Restrained. If a target has 3 or more bramble tokens, they are also Vulnerable. All bramble tokens can be removed by succeeding on a Finesse Roll (12 + the number of bramble tokens) or dealing Major or greater damage to the Swarm. If bramble tokens are removed from a target using a Finesse Roll, a number of Tangle Bramble Minions spawn within Melee range equal to the number of tokens removed.

monsters.name: Tangle Bramble
monsters.description: An animate, blood-drinking tumbleweed.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Consume, drain, entangle

feats.name: Minion (4) - Passive
feats.text: The Bramble is defeated when they take any damage. For every 4 damage a PC deals to the Tangle Bramble, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

feats.name: Group Attack - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Tangle Brambles within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 2 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

feats.name: Drain and Multiply - Reaction
feats.text: When an attack from the Bramble causes a target to mark HP and there are three or more Tangle Bramble Minions within Close range, you can combine the Minions into a Tangle Bramble Swarm Horde. The Horde’s HP is equal to the number of Minions combined.

monsters.name: Weaponmaster
monsters.description: A master-at-arms wielding a sword twice their size.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Act first, aim for the weakest, intimidate

feats.name: Goading Strike - Action
feats.text: Make a standard attack against a target. On a success, mark a Stress to Taunt the target until their next successful attack. The next time the Taunted target attacks, they have disadvantage against targets other than the Weaponmaster.

feats.name: Adrenaline Burst - Action
feats.text: Once per scene, spend a Fear to clear 2 HP and 2 Stress.

feats.name: Momentum - Reaction
feats.text: When the Weaponmaster makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

monsters.name: Brawny Zombie
monsters.description: A large corpse, decay-bloated and angry.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Crush, destroy, hurl debris, slam

feats.name: Slow - Passive
feats.text: When you spotlight the Zombie and they don’t have a token on their stat block, they can’t act yet. Place a token on their stat block and describe what they’re preparing to do. When you spotlight the Zombie and they have a token on their stat block, clear the token and they can act.

feats.name: Rend Asunder - Action
feats.text: Make a standard attack with advantage against a target the Zombie has Restrained. On a success, the attack deals direct damage.

feats.name: Rip and Tear - Reaction
feats.text: When the Zombies makes a successful standard attack, you can mark a Stress to temporarily Restrain the target and force them to mark 2 Stress.

monsters.name: Young Dryad
monsters.description: An imperious tree-person leading their forest’s defenses.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Command, nurture, prune the unwelcome

feats.name: Voice of the Forest - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to spotlight 1d4 allies within range of a target they can attack without moving. On a success, their attacks deal half damage.

feats.name: Thorny Cage - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to form a cage around a target within Very Close range and Restrain them until they’re freed with a successful Strength Roll. When a creature makes an action roll against the cage, they must mark a Stress.

feats.name: Momentum - Reaction
feats.text: When the Dryad makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

monsters.name: Patchwork Zombie Hulk
monsters.description: A towering gestalt of corpses moving as one, with torso-sized limbs and fists as large as a grown halfling.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Absorb corpses, flail, hunger, terrify

feats.name: Destructive - Passive
feats.text: When the Zombie takes Major or greater damage, they mark an additional HP.

feats.name: Flailing Limbs - Passive
feats.text: When the Zombie makes a standard attack, they can attack all targets within Very Close range.

feats.name: Another for the Pile - Action
feats.text: When the Zombie is within Very Close range of a corpse, they can incorporate it into themselves, clearing a HP and a Stress.

feats.name: Tormented Screams - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to cause all PCs within Far range to make a Presence Reaction Roll (13). Targets who fail lose a Hope and you gain a Fear for each. Targets who succeed must mark a Stress.

monsters.name: Rotted Zombie
monsters.description: A decaying corpse ambling toward their prey.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Eat flesh, hunger, maul, surround

feats.name: Minion (3) - Passive
feats.text: The Zombie is defeated when they take any damage. For every 3 damage a PC deals to the Zombie, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

feats.name: Group Attack - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Rotted Zombies within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 2 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

monsters.name: Shambling Zombie
monsters.description: An animated corpse that moves shakily, driven only by hunger.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Devour, hungry, mob enemy, shred flesh

feats.name: Too Many to Handle - Passive
feats.text: When the Zombie is within Melee range of a creature and at least one other Zombie is within Close range, all attacks against that creature have advantage.

feats.name: Horrifying - Passive
feats.text: Targets who mark HP from the Zombie’s attacks must also mark a Stress.

monsters.name: Zombie Pack
monsters.description: A group of shambling corpses instinctively moving together.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Consume flesh, hunger, maul

feats.name: Horde (1d4+2) - Passive
feats.text: When the Zombies have marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 1d4+2 physical damage instead.

feats.name: Overwhelm - Reaction
feats.text: When the Zombies mark HP from an attack within Melee range, you can mark a Stress to make a standard attack against the attacker.

monsters.name: Archer Squadron
monsters.description: A group of trained archers bearing massive bows.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Stick together, survive, volley fire

feats.name: Horde (1d6+3) - Passive
feats.text: When the Squadron has marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 1d6+3 physical damage instead.

feats.name: Focused Volley - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to target a point within Far range. Make an attack with advantage against all targets within Close range of that point. Targets the Squadron succeeds against take 1d10+4 physical damage.

feats.name: Suppressing Fire - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to target a point within Far range. Until the next roll with Fear, a creature who moves within Close range of that point must make an Agility Reaction Roll. On a failure, they take 2d6+3 physical damage. On a success, they take half damage.

monsters.name: Assassin Poisoner
monsters.description: A cunning scoundrel skilled in both poisons and ambushing.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Anticipate, get paid, kill, taint food and water

feats.name: Grindeloth Venom - Passive
feats.text: Targets who mark HP from the Assassin’s attacks are Vulnerable until they clear a HP.

feats.name: Out of Nowhere - Passive
feats.text: The Assassin has advantage on attacks if they are Hidden.

feats.name: Fumigation - Action
feats.text: Drop a smoke bomb that fills the air within Close range with smoke, Dizzilying all targets in this area. Dizzied targets have disadvantage on their next action roll, then clear the condition.

monsters.name: Apprentice Assassin
monsters.description: A young trainee eager to prove themselves.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Act reckless, kill, prove their worth, show off

feats.name: Minion (6) - Passive
feats.text: The Assassin is defeated when they take any damage. For every 6 damage a PC deals to the Assassin, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

feats.name: Group Attack - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Apprentice Assassins within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 4 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

monsters.name: Master Assassin
monsters.description: A seasoned killer with a threatening voice and a deadly blade.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Ambush, get out alive, kill, prepare for all scenarios

feats.name: Won’t See It Coming - Passive
feats.text: The Assassin deals direct damage while they’re Hidden.

feats.name: Strike as One - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to spotlight a number of other Assassins equal to the Assassin’s unmarked Stress.

feats.name: The Subtle Blade - Reaction
feats.text: When the Assassin successfully makes a standard attack against a Vulnerable target, you can spend a Fear to deal Severe damage instead of their standard damage.

feats.name: Momentum - Reaction
feats.text: When the Assassin makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

monsters.name: Battle Box
monsters.description: A cube-shaped construct with a different rune on each of their six sides.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Change tactics, trample foes, wait in disguise

feats.name: Relentless (2) - Passive
feats.text: The Box can be spotlighted up to two times per turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

feats.name: Randomized Tactics - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress and roll a d6. The Box uses the corresponding move: 1. Mana Beam: The Box fires a searing beam. Make an attack against a target within Far range. On a success, deal 2d10+2 magic damage. 2. Fire Jets: The Box shoots into the air, spinning and releasing jets of flame. Make an attack against all targets within Close range. Targets the Box succeeds against take 2d8 physical damage. 3. Trample: The Box rockets around erratically. Make an attack against all PCs within Close range. Targets the Box succeeds against take 1d6+5 physical damage and are Vulnerable until their next roll with Hope. 4. Shocking Gas: The Box sprays out a silver gas sparking with lightning. All targets within Close range must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll or mark 3 Stress. 5. Stunning Clap: The Box leaps and their sides clap, creating a concussive boom. All targets within Very Close range must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll or become Vulnerable until the cube is defeated. 6. Psonic Whine: The Box releases a cluster of mechanical bees whose buzz rattles mortal minds. All targets within Close range must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll or take 2d4+9 direct magic damage.

feats.name: Overcharge - Reaction
feats.text: Before rolling damage for the Box’s attack, you can mark a Stress to add a d6 to the damage roll. Additionally, you gain a Fear.

feats.name: Death Quake - Reaction
feats.text: When the Box marks their last HP, the magic powering them ruptures in an explosion of force. All targets within Close range must succeed on an Instinct Reaction Roll or take 2d8+1 magic damage.

monsters.name: Chaos Skull
monsters.description: A floating humanoid skull animated by scintillating magic.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Cackle, consume magic, serve creator

feats.name: Levitation - Passive
feats.text: The Skull levitates several feet off the ground and can’t be Restrained.

feats.name: Wards - Passive
feats.text: The Skull is resistant to magic damage.

feats.name: Magic Burst - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to make an attack against all targets within Close range. Targets the Skull succeeds against take 2d6+4 magic damage.

feats.name: Siphon Magic - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to make an attack against a PC with a Spellcast trait within Very Close range. On a success, the target marks 1d4 Stress and the Skull clears that many Stress. Additionally, on a success, the Skull can immediately be spotlighted again.

monsters.name: Conscript
monsters.description: A poorly trained civilian pressed into war.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Follow orders, gang up, survive

feats.name: Minion (6) - Passive
feats.text: The Conscript is defeated when they take any damage. For every 6 damage a PC deals to the Conscript, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

feats.name: Group Attack - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Conscripts within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 6 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

monsters.name: Courtesan
monsters.description: An accomplished manipulator and master of the social arts.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Entice, maneuver, secure patrons

feats.name: Searing Glance - Reaction
feats.text: When a PC within Close range makes a Presence Roll, you can mark a Stress to cast a gaze toward the aftermath. On the target’s failure, they must mark 2 Stress and are Vulnerable until the scene ends or they succeed on a social action against the Courtesan. On the target’s success, they must mark a Stress.

monsters.name: Cult Adept
monsters.description: An experienced mage wielding shadow and fear.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Curry favor, hinder foes, uncover knowledge

feats.name: Enervating Blast - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to make a standard attack against a target within range. On a success, the target must mark a Stress.

feats.name: Shroud of the Fallen - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to wrap an ally within Close range in a shroud of Protection until the Adept marks their last HP. While Protected, the target has resistance to all damage.

feats.name: Shadow Shackles - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear and choose a point within Far range. All targets within Close range of that point are Restrained in smoky chains until they break free with a successful Strength or Instinct Roll. A target Restrained by this feature must spend a Hope to make an action roll.

feats.name: Fear Is Fuel - Reaction
feats.text: Twice per scene, when a PC rolls a failure with Fear, clear a Stress.

monsters.name: Cult Fang
monsters.description: A professional killer-turned-cultist.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Capture sacrifices, isolate prey, rise in the ranks

feats.name: Shadow’s Embrace - Passive
feats.text: The Fang can climb and walk on vertical surfaces. Mark a Stress to move from one shadow to another within Far range.

feats.name: Pick Off the Straggler - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to cause a target within Melee range to make an Instinct Reaction Roll. On a failure, the target must mark 2 Stress and is teleported with the Fang to a shadow within Far range, making them temporarily Vulnerable. On a success, the target must mark a Stress.

monsters.name: Cult Initiate
monsters.description: A low-ranking cultist in simple robes, eager to gain power.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Follow orders, gain power, seek forbidden knowledge

feats.name: Minion (6) - Passive
feats.text: The Initiate is defeated when they take any damage. For every 6 damage a PC deals to the Initiate, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

feats.name: Group Attack - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Cult Initiates within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 5 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

monsters.name: Demonic Hound Pack
monsters.description: Unnatural hounds lit from within by hellfire.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Cause fear, consume flesh, please masters

feats.name: Horde (2d4+1) - Passive
feats.text: When the Pack has marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 2d4+1 physical damage instead.

feats.name: Dreadhowl - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to make all targets within Very Close range lose a Hope. If a target is not able to lose a Hope, they must instead mark 2 Stress.

feats.name: Momentum - Reaction
feats.text: When the Pack makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

monsters.name: Electric Eels
monsters.description: A swarm of eels that encircle and electrocute.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Avoid larger predators, shock prey, tear apart

feats.name: Horde (2d4+1) - Passive
feats.text: When the Eels have marked half or more of their HP, their standard attack deals 2d4+1 physical damage instead.

feats.name: Paralyzing Shock - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to make a standard attack against all targets within Very Close range. You gain a Fear for each target that marks HP.

monsters.name: Elite Soldier
monsters.description: An armored squire or experienced commoner looking to advance.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Gain glory, keep order, make alliances

feats.name: Reinforce - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to move into Melee range of an ally and make a standard attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, deal 2d10+2 physical damage and the ally can clear a Stress.

feats.name: Vassal’s Loyalty - Reaction
feats.text: When the Soldier is within Very Close range of a knight or other noble who would take damage, you can mark a Stress to move into Melee range of them and take the damage instead.

monsters.name: Failed Experiment
monsters.description: A magical necromantic experiment gone wrong, leaving them warped and ungainly.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Devour, hunt, track

feats.name: Warped Fortitude - Passive
feats.text: The Experiment is resistant to physical damage.

feats.name: Overwhelm - Passive
feats.text: When a target the Experiment attacks has other adversaries within Very Close range, the Experiment deals double damage.

feats.name: Lurching Lunge - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to spotlight the Experiment as an additional GM move instead of spending Fear.

monsters.name: Giant Beastmaster
monsters.description: A leather-clad warrior bearing a whip and massive bow.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Command, make a living, maneuver, pin down, protect companion animals

feats.name: Two as One - Passive
feats.text: When the Beastmaster is spotlighted, you can also spotlight a Tier 1 animal adversary currently under their control.

feats.name: Pinning Strike - Action
feats.text: Make a standard attack against a target. On a success, you can mark a Stress to pin them to a nearby surface. The pinned target is Restrained until they break free with a successful Finesse or Strength Roll.

feats.name: Deadly Companion - Action
feats.text: Twice per scene, summon a Bear, Dire Wolf, or similar Tier 1 animal adversary under the Beastmaster’s control. The adversary appears at Close range and is immediately spotlighted.

monsters.name: Giant Brawler
monsters.description: An especially muscular giant wielding a warhammer larger than a human.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Make a living, overwhelm, slam, topple

feats.name: Battering Ram - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to have the Brawler charge at an inanimate object within Close range they could feasibly smash (such as a wall, cart, or market stand) and destroy it. All targets within Very Close range of the object must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or take 2d4+3 physical damage from the shrapnel.

feats.name: Bloody Reprisal - Reaction
feats.text: When the Brawler marks 2 or more HP from an attack within Very Close range, you can make a standard attack against the attacker. On a success, the Brawler deals 2d6+15 physical damage instead of their standard damage.

feats.name: Momentum - Reaction
feats.text: When the Brawler makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

monsters.name: Giant Eagle
monsters.description: A giant bird of prey with blood-stained talons.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Hunt prey, stay mobile, strike decisively

feats.name: Flight - Passive
feats.text: While flying, the Eagle gains a +3 bonus to their Difficulty.

feats.name: Deadly Dive - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to attack a target within Far range. On a success, deal 2d10+2 physical damage and knock the target over, making them Vulnerable until they next act.

feats.name: Take Off - Action
feats.text: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, deal 2d4+3 physical damage and the target must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll or become temporarily Restrained within the Eagle’s massive talons. If the target is Restrained, the Eagle immediately lifts them to the air to Very Far range above the battlefield while holding them.

feats.name: Deadly Drop - Action
feats.text: While flying, the Eagle can drop a Restrained target they are holding. When dropped, the target is no longer Restrained but starts falling. If their fall isn’t prevented during the PCs’ next action, the target takes 2d20 physical damage when they land.

monsters.name: Giant Recruit
monsters.description: A giant fighter undergoing borrowed armor.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Batter, make a living, overwhelm, terrify

feats.name: Minion (7) - Passive
feats.text: The Recruit is defeated when they take any damage. For every 7 damage a PC deals to the Recruit, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

feats.name: Group Attack - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Giant Recruits within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 5 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

monsters.name: Gorgon
monsters.description: A snake-headed, scaled humanoid with a gilded bow, enraged that their peace has been disturbed.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Corner, hit-and-run, petrify, seek vengeance

feats.name: Relentless (2) - Passive
feats.text: The Gorgon can be spotlighted up to two times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

feats.name: Suneater Arrows - Passive
feats.text: When the Gorgon makes a successful standard attack, the target Glows until the end of the scene and can’t become Hidden. Attack rolls made against a Glowing target have advantage.

feats.name: Crown of Serpents - Action
feats.text: Make an attack roll against a target within Melee range using the Gorgon’s protective snakes. On a success, mark Stress to deal 2d10+4 physical damage and the target must mark a Stress.

feats.name: Petrifying Gaze - Reaction
feats.text: When the Gorgon takes damage from an attack within Close range, you can spend a Fear to force the attacker to make an Instinct Reaction Roll. On a failure, they begin to turn to stone, marking a HP and starting a Petrification Countdown (4). This countdown ticks down when the Gorgon is attacked. When it triggers, the target must make a death move. If the Gorgon is defeated, all petrification countdowns end.

feats.name: Death Glare - Reaction
feats.text: When the Gorgon makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

monsters.name: Juvenile Flickerfly
monsters.description: A horse-sized insect with iridescent scales and crystalline wings moving faster than the eye can see.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Collect shiny things, hunt, swoop

feats.name: Relentless (3) - Passive
feats.text: The Flickerfly can be spotlighted up to three times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

feats.name: Peerless Accuracy - Passive
feats.text: Before the Flickerfly makes an attack, roll a d6. On a result of 4 or higher, the target’s Evasion is halved against this attack.

feats.name: Mind Dance - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to create a magically dazzling display that grapples the minds of nearby foes. All targets within Close range must make an Instinct Reaction Roll. For each target who failed, you gain a Fear and the Flickerfly learns one of the target’s fears.

feats.name: Hallucinatory Breath - Reaction: Countdown (Loop 1d6)
feats.text: When the Flickerfly takes damage for the first time, activate the countdown. When it triggers, the Flickerfly breathes hallucinatory gas on all targets in front of them up to Far range. Targets must succeed on an Instinct Reaction Roll or be tormented by fearful hallucinations. Targets whose fears are known to the Flickerfly have disadvantage on this roll. Targets who fail must mark a Stress and lose a Hope.

monsters.name: Knight of the Realm
monsters.description: A decorated soldier with heavy armor and a powerful steed.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Run down, seek glory, show dominance

feats.name: Chevalier - Passive
feats.text: While the Knight is on a mount, they gain a +2 bonus to their Difficulty. When they take Severe damage, they’re knocked from their mount and lose this benefit until they’re next spotlighted.

feats.name: Heavily Armored - Passive
feats.text: When the Knight takes physical damage, reduce it by 3.

feats.name: Cavalry Charge - Action
feats.text: If the Knight is mounted, move up to Far range and make a standard attack against a target. On a success, deal 2d8+4 physical damage and the target must mark a Stress.

feats.name: For the Realm! - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to spotlight 1d4+1 allies. Attacks they make while spotlighted in this way deal half damage.

monsters.name: Masked Thief
monsters.description: A cunning thief with acrobatic skill and a flair for the dramatic.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Evade, hide, pilfer, profit

feats.name: Quick Hands - Action
feats.text: Make an attack against a target within Melee range. On a success, deal 1d8+2 physical damage and the Thief steals one item or consumable from the target’s inventory.

feats.name: Escape Plan - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to reveal a snare trap set anywhere on the battlefield by the Thief. All targets within Very Close range of the trap must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll (13) or be pulled off their feet and suspended upside down. The target is Restrained and Vulnerable until they break free, ending both conditions, with a successful Finesse or Strength Roll (13).

monsters.name: Merchant Baron
monsters.description: An accomplished merchant with a large operation under their command.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Abusive power, gather resources, mobilize minions

feats.name: Everyone Has a Price - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to offer a target a dangerous bargain for something they want or need. If used on a PC, they must make a Presence Reaction Roll (17). On a failure, they must mark 2 Stress or take the deal.

feats.name: The Best Muscle Money Can Buy - Action
feats.text: Once per scene, mark a Stress to summon 1d4+1 Tier 1 adversaries, who appear at Far range, to enforce the Baron’s will.

monsters.name: Minotaur Wrecker
monsters.description: A massive bull-headed hybrid with a quick temper.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Consume, gore, navigate, overpower, pursue

feats.name: Ramp Up - Passive
feats.text: You must spend a Fear to spotlight the Minotaur. While spotlighted, they can make their standard attack against all targets within range.

feats.name: Charging Bull - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to charge through a group within Close range and make an attack against all targets in the Minotaur’s path. Targets the Minotaur succeeds against take 2d6+8 physical damage and are knocked back to Very Far range. If a target is knocked into a solid object or another creature, they take an extra 1d6 damage (combine their damage).

feats.name: Gore - Action
feats.text: Make an attack against a target within Very Close range, moving the Minotaur into Melee range of them. On a success, deal 2d8 direct physical damage.

monsters.name: Mortal Hunter
monsters.description: An undead figure wearing a heavy leather coat, with searching eyes and a cruelly cut demeanor.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Devour, hunt, track

feats.name: Terrifying - Passive
feats.text: When the Hunter makes a successful attack, all PCs within Far range lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.

feats.name: Deathlock - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to curse a target within Very Close range with a necrotic Deathlock until the end of the scene. Attacks made by the Hunter against a Deathlocked target deal direct damage. The Hunter can only maintain one Deathlock at a time.

feats.name: Inevitable Death - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to spotlight 1d4 allies. Attacks they make while spotlighted in this way deal half damage.

feats.name: Rampage - Reaction
feats.text: Countdown (Loop 1d6). When the Hunter is in the spotlight for the first time, activate the countdown. When it triggers, move the Hunter in a straight line to a point within Far range and make an attack against all targets in their path. Targets the Hunter succeeds against take 2d8+2 physical damage.

monsters.name: Royal Advisor
monsters.description: A high-ranking courtier with the ear of the local nobility.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Curry favor, manufacture evidence, scheme

feats.name: Devastating Retort - Passive
feats.text: A PC who rolls less than 17 on an action roll targeting the Advisor must mark a Stress.

feats.name: Bend Ears - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to influence an NPC within Melee range with whispered words. That target’s opinion on one matter shifts toward the Advisor’s preference unless it is in direct opposition to the target’s motives.

feats.name: Scapegoat - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to convince a crowd or notable individual that one person or group is responsible for some problem facing the target. The target becomes hostile to the scapegoat until convinced of their innocence with a successful Presence Roll (17).

monsters.name: Secret-Keeper
monsters.description: A clandestine leader with a direct channel to the Fallen Gods.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Amass great power, plot, take command

feats.name: Seize Your Moment - Action
feats.text: Spend 2 Fear to spotlight 1d4 allies. Attacks they make while spotlighted in this way deal half damage.

feats.name: Our Master’s Will - Reaction
feats.text: When you spotlight an ally within Far range, mark a Stress to gain a Fear.

feats.name: Summoning Ritual - Reaction
feats.text: Countdown (6). When the Secret-Keeper is in the spotlight for the first time, activate the countdown. When they mark HP, tick down this countdown by the number of HP marked. When it triggers, summon a Minor Demon who appears at Close range.

feats.name: Fallen Hounds - Reaction
feats.text: Once per scene, when the Secret-Keeper marks 2 or more HP, you can mark a Stress to summon a Demonic Hound Pack, which appears at Close range and is immediately spotlighted.

monsters.name: Shark
monsters.description: A large aquatic predator, always on the move.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Find the blood, isolate prey, target the weak

feats.name: Terrifying - Passive
feats.text: When the Shark makes a successful attack, all PCs within Far range lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.

feats.name: Rending Bite - Passive
feats.text: When the Shark makes a successful attack, the target must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can’t mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

feats.name: Blood in the Water - Reaction
feats.text: When a creature within Close range of the Shark marks HP from another creature’s attack, you can mark a Stress to immediately spotlight the Shark, moving them into Melee range of the target and making a standard attack.

monsters.name: Siren
monsters.description: A half fish person with shimmering scales and an irresistible voice.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Consume, lure prey, subdue with song

feats.name: Captive Audience - Passive
feats.text: If the Siren makes a standard attack against a target Entranced by their song, the attack deals 2d10+1 damage instead of their standard damage.

feats.name: Enchanting Song - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to sing a song that affects all targets within Close range. Targets must succeed on an Instinct Reaction Roll or become Entranced until they mark 2 Stress. Other Sirens within Close range of the target can mark a Stress to each add a +1 bonus to the Difficulty of the reaction roll. While Entranced, a target can’t act and is Vulnerable.

monsters.name: Spectral Archer
monsters.description: A ghostly fighter with an ethereal bow, unable to move on while their charge is vulnerable.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Move through solid objects, stay out of the fray, rehash old battles

feats.name: Ghost - Passive
feats.text: The Archer has resistance to physical damage. Mark a Stress to move up to Close range through solid objects.

feats.name: Pick Your Target - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to make an attack against a target within Very Close range of at least two other PCs. On a success, the target takes 2d8+12 physical damage.

monsters.name: Spectral Captain
monsters.description: A ghostly commander leading their troops beyond death.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Move through solid objects, rally troops, rehash old battles

feats.name: Ghost - Passive
feats.text: The Captain has resistance to physical damage. Mark a Stress to move up to Close range through solid objects.

feats.name: Unending Battle - Action
feats.text: Spend 2 Fear to return up to 1d4+1 defeated Spectral allies to the battle at the points where they first appeared (with no marked HP or Stress).

feats.name: Hold Fast - Reaction
feats.text: When the Captain’s Spectral allies are forced to make a reaction roll, you can mark a Stress to give those allies a +2 bonus to the roll.

feats.name: Momentum - Reaction
feats.text: When the Captain makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

monsters.name: Spectral Guardian
monsters.description: A ghostly fighter with spears and swords, anchored by duty.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Move through solid objects, protect treasure, rehash old battles

feats.name: Ghost - Passive
feats.text: The Guardian has resistance to physical damage. Mark a Stress to move up to Close range through solid objects.

feats.name: Grave Blade - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to make an attack against a target within Very Close range. On a success, deal 2d10+6 physical damage and the target must mark a Stress.

monsters.name: Spy
monsters.description: A skilled espionage agent with a knack for being in the right place to overhear secrets.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Cut and run, disguise appearance, eavesdrop

feats.name: Gathering Secrets - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to describe how the Spy knows a secret about a PC in the scene.

feats.name: Fly on the Wall - Reaction
feats.text: When a PC or group is discussing something sensitive, you can mark a Stress to reveal that the Spy is present in the scene, observing them. If the Spy escapes the scene to report their findings, you gain 1d4 Fear.

monsters.name: Stonewraith
monsters.description: A prowling hunter, like a slinking mountain lion, with a slate-gray stone body.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Defend territory, isolate prey, stalk

feats.name: Stonestrider - Passive
feats.text: The Stonewraith can move through stone and earth as easily as air. While within stone or earth, they are Hidden and immune to all damage.

feats.name: Rocky Ambush - Action
feats.text: While Hidden, mark a Stress to leap into Melee range with a target within Very Close range. The target must succeed on an Agility or Instinct Reaction Roll (15) or take 2d8 physical damage and become temporarily Restrained.

feats.name: Avalanche Roar - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to roar while within a cave and cause a cave-in. All targets within Close range must succeed on an Agility Reaction Roll (14) or take 2d10 physical damage. The rubble can be cleared with a Progress Countdown (8).

feats.name: Momentum - Reaction
feats.text: When the Stonewraith makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

monsters.name: War Wizard
monsters.description: A battle-hardened mage trained in destructive magic.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Develop new spells, seek power, conquer

feats.name: Battle Teleport - Passive
feats.text: Before or after making a standard attack, you can mark a Stress to teleport to a location within Far range.

feats.name: Refresh Warding Sphere - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to refresh the Wizard’s “Warding Sphere” reaction.

feats.name: Eruption - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear and choose a point within Far range. A Very Close area around that point erupts into impassable terrain. All targets within that area must make an Agility Reaction Roll (14). Targets who fail take 2d10 physical damage and are thrown out of the area. Targets who succeed take half damage and aren’t moved.

feats.name: Arcane Artillery - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to unleash a precise hail of magical blasts. All targets in the scene must make an Agility Reaction Roll. Targets who fail take 2d12 magic damage. Targets who succeed take half damage.

feats.name: Warding Sphere - Reaction
feats.text: When the Wizard takes damage from an attack within Close range, deal 2d6 magic damage to the attacker. This reaction can’t be used again until the Wizard refreshes it with their “Refresh Warding Sphere” action.

monsters.name: Adult Flickerfly
monsters.description: A winged insect the size of a large house with iridescent scales and wings that move too fast to track.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Collect shiny things, hunt, nest, swoop

feats.name: Relentless (4) - Passive
feats.text: The Flickerfly can be spotlighted up to four times per GM turn. Spend Fear as usual to spotlight them.

feats.name: Never Misses - Passive
feats.text: When the Flickerfly makes an attack, the target’s Evasion is halved against the attack.

feats.name: Deadly Flight - Passive
feats.text: While flying, the Flickerfly can move up to Far range instead of Close range before taking an action.

feats.name: Whirlwind - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to whirl, making an attack against all targets within Very Close range. Targets the Flickerfly succeeds against take 3d8 direct physical damage.

feats.name: Mind Dance - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to create a magically dazzling display that grapples the minds of nearby foes. All targets within Close range must make an Instinct Reaction Roll. For each target who failed, you gain a Fear and the Flickerfly learns one of the target’s fears.

feats.name: Hallucinatory Breath - Action: Countdown (Loop 1d6)
feats.text: When the Flickerfly takes damage for the first time, activate the countdown. When it triggers, the Flickerfly breathes hallucinatory gas on all targets in front of them up to Far range. Targets must make an Instinct Reaction Roll or become overwhelmed by fearful hallucinations. Targets whose fears are known to the Flickerfly have disadvantage on this roll. Targets who fail lose 2 Hope and take 3d8+3 direct magic damage.

feats.name: Uncanny Reflexes - Reaction
feats.text: When the Flickerfly takes damage from an attack within Close range, you can mark a Stress to take half damage.

monsters.name: Demon of Avarice
monsters.description: A regal cloaked monstrosity with circular horns adorned with treasure.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Consume, fuel greed, sow dissent

feats.name: Money Talks - Passive
feats.text: Attacks against the Demon are made with disadvantage unless the attacker spends a handful of gold. This Demon starts with a number of handfuls equal to the number of PCs. When a target marks HP from the Demon’s standard attack, they can spend a handful of gold instead of marking HP (1 handful per HP). Add a handful of gold to the Demon for each handful of gold spent by PCs on this feature.

feats.name: Numbers Must Go Up - Passive
feats.text: Add a bonus to the Demon’s attack rolls equal to the number of handfuls of gold they have.

feats.name: Money is Time - Action
feats.text: Spend 3 handfuls of gold (or a Fear) to spotlight 1d4+1 allies.

monsters.name: Demon of Despair
monsters.description: A cloaked one-creature with long limbs, seeping shadows.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Make fear contagious, stick to the shadows, undermine resolve

feats.name: Depths of Despair - Passive
feats.text: The Demon deals double damage to PCs with 0 Hope.

feats.name: Your Struggle Is Pointless - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to weigh down the spirits of all PCs within Far range. All targets affected replace their Hope Die with a d8 until they roll a success with Hope or their next rest.

feats.name: Your Friends Will Fail You - Reaction
feats.text: When a PC fails with Fear, you can mark a Stress to cause all other PCs within Close range to lose a Hope.

feats.name: Momentum - Reaction
feats.text: When the Demon makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

monsters.name: Demon of Hubris
monsters.description: A perfectly beautiful and infinitely cruel demon with a gleaming spear and elegant robes.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Condescend, declare premature victory, prove superiority

feats.name: Terrifying - Passive
feats.text: When the Demon makes a successful attack, all PCs within Far range must lose a Hope and you gain a Fear.

feats.name: Double or Nothing - Passive
feats.text: When a PC within Far range fails a roll, they can choose to reroll their Fear Die and take the new result. If they still fail, they mark 2 Stress and the Demon clears a Stress.

feats.name: Unparalleled Skill - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to deal the Demon’s standard attack damage to a target within Close range.

feats.name: The Root of Villainy - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to spotlight two other Demons within Far range.

feats.name: You Pale in Comparison - Reaction
feats.text: When a PC fails a roll within Close range of the Demon, they must mark a Stress.

monsters.name: Demon of Jealousy
monsters.description: A fickle creature of spindly limbs and insatiable desires.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Join in on others’ success, take what belongs to others, hold grudges

feats.name: Unprotected Mind - Passive
feats.text: The Demon’s standard attack deals direct damage.

feats.name: My Turn - Reaction
feats.text: When the Demon marks HP from an attack, spend a number of Fear equal to the HP marked by the Demon to cause the attacker to mark the same number of HP.

feats.name: Rivalry - Reaction
feats.text: When a creature within Close range takes damage from a different adversary, you can mark a Stress to add a d4 to the damage roll.

feats.name: What’s Yours Is Mine - Reaction
feats.text: When a PC takes severe damage within Very Close range of the Demon, you can spend a Fear to cause the target to make a Finesse Reaction Roll. On a failure, the Demon seizes one item or consumable of their choice from the target’s inventory.

monsters.name: Demon of Wrath
monsters.description: A hulking demon with boulder-sized fists, driven by endless rage.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Fuel anger, impress rivals, wreak havoc

feats.name: Anger Unrelenting - Passive
feats.text: The Demon’s attacks deal direct damage.

feats.name: Battle Lust - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to boil the blood of all PCs within Far range. They use a d20 as their Fear Die until the end of the scene.

feats.name: Retaliation - Reaction
feats.text: When the Demon takes damage from an attack within Close range, you can mark a Stress to make a standard attack against the attacker.

feats.name: Blood and Souls - Reaction: Countdown (Loop 6)
feats.text: Activate the first time an attack is made within sight of the Demon. It ticks down when a PC takes a violent action. When it triggers, summon 1d4 Minor Demons, who appear at Close range.

monsters.name: Dire Bat
monsters.description: A winged pet endlessly loyal to their vampire owner.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Dive-bomb, hide, protect leader

feats.name: Flying - Passive
feats.text: While flying, the Bat gains a +3 bonus to their Difficulty.

feats.name: Screech - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to send a high-pitch screech out toward all targets in front of the Bat within Far range. Those targets must mark 1d4 Stress.

feats.name: Guardian - Reaction
feats.text: When an allied Vampire marks HP, you can mark a Stress to fly into Melee range of the attacker and make an attack with advantage against them. On a success, deal 2d6+2 physical damage.

monsters.name: Dryad
monsters.description: A nature spirit in the form of a humanoid tree.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Camouflage, drive out, preserve the forest

feats.name: Bramble Patch - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to target a point within Far range. Create a patch of thorns that covers an area within Close range of that point. All targets within that area take 2d6+2 physical damage when they act. A target must succeed on a Finesse Roll or take more than 20 damage to the Dryad with an attack to leave the area.

feats.name: Group Saplings - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to grow three Treant Sapling Minions, who appear at Close range and immediately take the spotlight.

feats.name: We Are All One - Reaction
feats.text: When an ally dies within Close range, you can spend a Fear to clear 2 HP and 2 Stress as the fallen ally’s life force is returned to the forest.

monsters.name: Elemental Spark
monsters.description: A blazing mote of elemental fire.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Blast, consume, gain mass

feats.name: Minion (9) - Passive
feats.text: The Elemental is defeated when they take any damage. For every 9 damage a PC deals to the Elemental, defeat an additional Minion within range the attack would succeed against.

feats.name: Group Attack - Action
feats.text: Spend a Fear to choose a target and spotlight all Elemental Sparks within Close range of them. Those Minions move into Melee range of the target and make one shared attack roll. On a success, they deal 5 physical damage each. Combine this damage.

monsters.name: Greater Earth Elemental
monsters.description: A living landslide of boulders and dust, as large as a house.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Avalanche, knock over, pummel

feats.name: Slow - Passive
feats.text: When you spotlight the Elemental and they don’t have a token on their stat block, they can’t act yet. Place a token on their stat block and describe what they’re preparing to do. When you spotlight the Elemental and they have a token on their stat block, clear the token and they can act.

feats.name: Crushing Blows - Passive
feats.text: When the Elemental makes a successful attack, the target must mark an Armor Slot without receiving its benefits (they can still use armor to reduce the damage). If they can’t mark an Armor Slot, they must mark an additional HP.

feats.name: Immovable Object - Passive
feats.text: An attack that would move the Elemental moves them two fewer ranges (for example, Far becomes Very Close). When the Elemental takes physical damage, reduce it by 7.

feats.name: Rockslide - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to create a rockslide that buries all the land in front of Elemental within Close range with rockfall. All targets in this area must make an Agility Reaction Roll (19). Targets who fail take 2d12+5 physical damage and become Vulnerable until their next roll with Hope. Targets who succeed take half damage.

feats.name: Momentum - Reaction
feats.text: When the Elemental makes a successful attack against a PC, you gain a Fear.

monsters.name: Greater Water Elemental
monsters.description: A huge living wave that crashes down upon enemies.
monsters.motives_and_tactics: Deluge, disperse, drown

feats.name: Water Jet - Action
feats.text: Mark a Stress to attack a target within Very Close range. On a success, deal 2d4+7 physical damage and the target’s next action has disadvantage. On a failure, the target must mark a Stress.
